item.title: Bee attack injures several dozen in France
item.description: Twenty-four people were stung, with a witness describing how "very panicked people" tried to bat off the bees.

item.title: Acropolis closes as heatwave grips Greece
item.description: The popular Athens attraction is shutting temporarily as highs of 42C are forecast for parts of the country.

item.title: Trump upbeat on Gaza ceasefire talks despite lack of breakthrough
item.description: The US president said talk were going "very well", but a Palestinian source tells the BBC they have not made headway.

item.title: 'Hero' dad, twin girls and riverside campers among Texas flood victims
item.description: At least 104 lives were lost after a rapid deluge in the centre of the US state on Friday.

item.title: Israeli defence minister plans to move Gaza's population to camp in Rafah
item.description: Israel Katz tells Israeli media the so-called "humanitarian city" in Rafah will eventually house 2.1 million Palestinians.
